required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Drug Coated Balloon Versus Stenting in Patients With Symptomatic Vertebral Artery Stenosis：an Observational Clinical Study

brief_summary.textblock: There are two arms in our trial, DCB group, BMS group.The investigators are going to investigate the safety and efficacy of all groups at 6 months and 12 months.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of vascular death,non-fatal myocardial and non-fatal stroke in 12 months
primary_outcome.description: vascular death,non-fatal myocardial and non-fatal stroke diagnosed by specialist physician

secondary_outcome.description: lumen loss measured by doppler untrasound
lumen loss measured by doppler untrasound
restenosis was assessed by doppler untrasound
restenosis was assessed by doppler untrasound
traget lesion revascularizition including envascular intervention and Surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of safety events including vascular death,non-fatal myocardial infarction, or non-fatal stroke in 30 days
secondary_outcome.description: safety events including vascular death,non-fatal myocardial infarction, or non-fatal stroke diagnosed by investigators within 30 days after start of the treatment
stent fracture was assessed by DSA

arm_group.description: patients with vertebral artery origin stenosis treated with drug-coated balloons
patients with vertebral artery origin stenosis treated with bare metal stent

intervention.description: any type of bare metal stent

study_pop.textblock: patients meet all of the inclusion criteria and none of the excusion criteria

facility.name: The first affiliated hospital of Dalian medical university
The first affiliated hospital of Harbin medical university
The first hospital of Jilin university
Shengjing Hosptal of china medical university
The first hospital of zhengzhou university
